intro: Drosanthemum breve, commonly known as the dwarf drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, making it a compact and ornamental species. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in shades of yellow and orange, adding a vibrant touch to gardens. Drosanthemum breve prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in arid conditions.
